content: repeat row 3 and 4 until all stitches of the heel have been worked you will end with a completed row 4 there should be 20 sts remaining on the heel flap divide heel stitches evenly onto two needles and place the instep stitches on one needle the beginning of the round is now at the center of the heel needle 1 has 10 stitches needle 2 has 36 stitches and needle 3 has 10 stitches you can place a marker for the beginning of the round if you wish but i find it quite easy to see without one as you just look for where your heel flap is using needle 1 pick up 18 stitches from side of heel flap and pick up 2 stitches at the top of the gusset our heel flap has a garter edge along this edge you will see little bumps and little threads between them we are picking up the threads between the bumps starting with the thread before the first bump as for the stitches at the top of the gusset it s helpful to angle the sock a little you want to pick up a stitch from the left leg of the first stitch of the heel flap right before the gusset and the second stitch from the right leg of the first stitch on your instep needle this will prevent a gap in that location using needle 2 knit across the instep using needle 3 pick up two stitches at the top of the gusset mirroring the picked up gusset stitches at the end of needle 1 pick up 18 stitches from the side of the heel flap knit the remaining stitches on the heel needle 1 30 sts needle 2 36 sts needle 3 30 sts gusset setup round closing gusset top needle 1 k to last 2 stitches ssk needle 2 knit needle 3 k2tog k to end round 1 needle 1 k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle 2 k across needle 3 k1 ssk k to end round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 72 total stitches remain this is back to where we started on the leg there will be 18 stitches on needle 1 36 on needle 2 and 18 on needle 3 foot knit in stockinette stitch until the piece from the back of the heel to the live edge measures 8 1/2 inches you don t have to keep track of where the beginning of the round is at this point as we re going to move it again to do the toe just knit around and around until you have the right measurement toe instructions are for a standard round toe from the sock knitter s handbook p 75 knit until you reach the needle with half your stitches this is now the beginning of your round round 1 needle 1 k1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle 2 k1 ssk k to end
